summary: Overall, Mexico experienced scattered unrest, with political tensions driving both protests and riots. Security forces remained in control of most urban centers.
Riots erupted in major cities following controversial reforms, especially in the northern regions.
Protests continued across the country with moderate participation and low disruption.
Sudan remained in crisis with persistent fighting in Darfur and Khartoum. Civilian safety and humanitarian conditions worsened.
Violent clashes intensified in Darfur and Khartoum, resulting in civilian casualties and displacement.
Myanmar saw rising strategic military movements alongside localized protests. Northern regions remained tense.
The military repositioned forces in northern regions, signaling preparation for a major offensive.
Georgia experienced heightened political unrest, with Tbilisi being the center of mass mobilization. Minor violence occurred near disputed regions.
Anti-government protests gained momentum in Tbilisi, drawing international attention.
Incidents of political violence against civilians were reported in disputed territories.
